instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage primarily in <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> area. Replaced <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.30V  Meter is cycling on and off to 5v 0.25 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC_XB_LDO_CORE</SIGNAL> 1.5V

<SIGNAL>PP1V5_UPC_XA_LDO_CORE</SIGNAL> 1.5V

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> 1.8V

Checked on another mac and its currently not in DFU mode. No liquid damage anywhere around <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>/<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
USB-C ampmeter goes on/off, or just current indication varies 0-0.25A?

Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present; the small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.
If yes, it should go into DFU.

G3S and SSD voltages come on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
USB-C ampmeter goes on/off

all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present

0V G3s and SSD voltages

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
The mentioned onboard voltages fluctuates at same time with USB-C ampmeter?
Check what happens connecting charged battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
Yes, onboard voltages fluctuates at same time with USB-C ampmeter.

When a battery is connected, the meter does not come on at all, if it does its only for 1-2 seconds. Meter is on around 10 seconds without battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
There must be something more affected by corrosion.
You can't enter DFU mode if USB-C voltage cycles on/off.

What voltages do you get connecting a charged battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message: I do not have a spare charged battery for this model. Any other suggestions or just order a battery  for this repair?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
Maybe is not the battery in this case, but should be good to have a tool to discard it.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.laptopu.ro/[/URL]
The tester worth the money and you can purchase later the reset license.
